title: How to Make a Pipe Cleaner Dragonfly

steps.headline: Take two pipe cleaners, each a different but complementary color.
steps.description: Bend one pipe cleaner into the shape of a long U. Twist the other one around the two stems, as shown in the image. This forms the body's middle and holds the folded pipe cleaner in place.

steps.headline: Wind a third pipe cleaner around the stems near the top to form the head.
steps.description: The color of this pipe cleaner should match the one wound around to form the body. Be sure to leave enough pipe cleaner at each end to form the two "antennas" coming out of the head. Simply bend each end over in a U shape to form the antennas.

steps.headline: Take two pipe cleaners to use for the long and graceful wings of the dragonfly.
steps.description:
Use the same color as the pipe cleaner used for the body. To shape the wings:
Bend two more pipe cleaners into U shapes at each end, using the middle of the pipe cleaner as the dividing point for each U shape. Then, slightly kink the middle of the pipe cleaner, as shown. Reshape the U shapes into as wing-like a shape as possible.

steps.headline: Twist the wings into position on the body.
steps.description: To do this, wrap or fold the loose ends slightly around the body of the dragonfly, just enough to attach without taking away the wing shape. Make readjustments to the wing shape as needed. For added effect, try pasting some colored tissue paper over the wings.

steps.headline: Display the dragonfly.
steps.description: The dragonfly can now be displayed by hanging using invisible thread. Or simply place it on a shelf or add to a craft project. If wearing as jewelry, attach a finding such as a brooch backing, using craft glue. Other uses include: Adding to a collage or picture, toys for children over 3, decorations on children's lunchboxes/bags/totes/water bottles, etc., attachments to gift cards or gift wrapping, a decoration for a small treasures box lid, etc.

text:
Creating the Body and Head Take two pipe cleaners, each a different but complementary color. Bend one pipe cleaner into the shape of a long U. Twist the other one around the two stems, as shown in the image. This forms the body's middle and holds the folded pipe cleaner in place. Wind a third pipe cleaner around the stems near the top to form the head. The color of this pipe cleaner should match the one wound around to form the body. Be sure to leave enough pipe cleaner at each end to form the two "antennas" coming out of the head. Simply bend each end over in a U shape to form the antennas. Making the Wings Take two pipe cleaners to use for the long and graceful wings of the dragonfly. Use the same color as the pipe cleaner used for the body. To shape the wings:
Bend two more pipe cleaners into U shapes at each end, using the middle of the pipe cleaner as the dividing point for each U shape. Then, slightly kink the middle of the pipe cleaner, as shown. Reshape the U shapes into as wing-like a shape as possible. Twist the wings into position on the body. To do this, wrap or fold the loose ends slightly around the body of the dragonfly, just enough to attach without taking away the wing shape. Make readjustments to the wing shape as needed. For added effect, try pasting some colored tissue paper over the wings. Display the dragonfly. The dragonfly can now be displayed by hanging using invisible thread. Or simply place it on a shelf or add to a craft project. If wearing as jewelry, attach a finding such as a brooch backing, using craft glue. Other uses include: Adding to a collage or picture, toys for children over 3, decorations on children's lunchboxes/bags/totes/water bottles, etc., attachments to gift cards or gift wrapping, a decoration for a small treasures box lid, etc.
